p:
Rosa damascena Mill. (Damask rose), is one of the most important aromatic species of Rosaceae family from which essential oils and high economic value products can be obtained and widely used in various pharmaceuticals, food, perfume, and cosmetic industries
2 . Petals and jars of flowers are as a rich source of Vitamin C, and their essential oil have sedative properties and antiviral and antibacterial effects
3, 4 . The most important components of the essential oil are citronellol, nonadecane, heneicosane, Î²-caryophyllene, geraniol, nerol, linalool, and phenyl ethyl acetate
5 .
